meanings.definition: The state of being isolated or cut off from others.
meanings.sent1: After the postisolation, she felt lonely and disconnected from everyone.
meanings.sent2: The postisolation of the island made it hard for the villagers to communicate with the mainland.
meanings.sent3: During the postisolation, the cat missed playing with its friends in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The postisolation was like a thick fog separating him from the rest of the world.
meanings.sent5: The postisolation felt like being trapped in a bubble, unable to reach out to others.

meanings.definition: The act of isolating or separating from others.
meanings.sent1: The postisolation of the patient was necessary to prevent the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent2: The postisolation of the troublemakers helped maintain peace in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The postisolation of the naughty puppy lasted only a few minutes before he found his way back to the group.
meanings.sent4: Her postisolation from the toxic relationship was a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The postisolation of the ingredients ensured that the recipe would turn out perfectly.

meanings.definition: A period of time following isolation or separation.
meanings.sent1: The postisolation after the storm allowed the community to come together and rebuild.
meanings.sent2: During the postisolation, she reflected on the lessons learned while being apart.
meanings.sent3: The postisolation was a time of self-discovery and growth for him.
meanings.sent4: In the postisolation, they realized the importance of human connection.
meanings.sent5: The postisolation felt like a cocoon, preparing her for the next phase of life.
